TopicTitle: KSP v1.12.2 modded,Unity crash occurred, preventing the game from restarting properly.

Articles.Content:
Player log:https://drive.google.com/file/d/1YNTxM2nPtVaneDuUOeoKDgZbMvHYKBEG/view?usp=drive_link

Shortly after starting the career mode, my game started crashing intermittently. It happens whether I'm in orbit or landed, occurring approximately every three to four hours. However, after landing my rover on Duna, the frequency of these crashes increased to about once every hour. Moreover, once my rover arrived a place near the north polar icy area and the midland sea, the game became almost unplayable. Whether I move the rover or not, the game crashes after two to three minutes.

When the crash occurs, a window briefly appears, indicating a Unity crash. It displays a kerman and a red exclamation mark.Afterward,the game freezes.

Meanwhile, after the crash, if I attempt to launch the game again, the startup speed becomes extremely slow. The RAM usage increases from the original 2GB to approximately 10GB, and upon entering the menu interface, the game becomes very laggy. Essentially, I am trapped in the menu interface and can only force close the game using the Task Manager. As a result, I am forced to restart my computer. After the restart, the startup and lag issues are resolved, and the game returns to normal. If I don't restart, the game will remain in the aforementioned state.

However, in my other save file, when I attempted to build an SSTO using MK4 ,B9,and other mod’s parts, the game behaved normally, and crashes were almost non-existent. After that, I tried various troubleshooting steps such as uninstalling and reinstalling mods (the game seemed to work fine in a pure stock state), launching with d3d12 and d3d9, and installing optimization mods, but none of them resolved the issue.

The specifications of my laptop are as follows:

CPU: i5-12400

RAM: 16G 3200MHz

GPU: RTX 3070 Laptop

Storage: 1TB NVME SSD

 All hardware drivers have been updated to the latest version.

Mods：

The logs are saying there's a d3d11 error (error code 0x887a0005) just before the crash. I remember seeing something similar a while ago and I think the issue was caused by outdated GPU drivers, so try updating those?

There are also some errors about non-ASCII characters, including in the Duna vessel that's being loaded just before the crash. It might just be coincidence, but try changing the name and see if that helps?
